detaileddescription.para: add this header to any url requests from this browser
CALLBACKS
These set of functions are used as responses to callback requests
You MUST call this in response to a HTML_StartRequest_t callback
Set bAllowed to true to allow this navigation, false to cancel it and stay
on the current page. You can use this feature to limit the valid pages
allowed in your HTML surface.
copy the currently selected text on the html page to the local clipboard
Create a browser object for display of a html page, when creation is complete the call handle
will return a HTML_BrowserReady_t callback for the HHTMLBrowser of your new browser.
The user agent string is a substring to be added to the general user agent string so you can
identify your client on web servers.
The userCSS string lets you apply a CSS style sheet to every displayed page, leave null if
you do not require this functionality.
YOU MUST HAVE IMPLEMENTED HANDLERS FOR HTML_BrowserReady_t, HTML_StartRequest_t,
HTML_JSAlert_t, HTML_JSConfirm_t, and HTML_FileOpenDialog_t! See the CALLBACKS
section of this interface (AllowStartRequest, etc) for more details. If you do
not implement these callback handlers, the browser may appear to hang instead of
navigating to new pages or triggering javascript popups.
run this javascript script in the currently loaded page
You MUST call this in response to a HTML_FileOpenDialog_t callback

memberdef.argsstring: (HHTMLBrowser unBrowserHandle, string pchSearchStr, bool bCurrentlyInFind, bool bReverse)
memberdef.name: Find

detaileddescription.para: find this string in the browser, if bCurrentlyInFind is true then instead cycle to the next matching element
return details about the link at position x,y on the current page
navigate back in the page history
navigate forward in the page history
Must call init and shutdown when starting/ending use of the interface
You MUST call this in response to a HTML_JSAlert_t or HTML_JSConfirm_t callback
Set bResult to true for the OK option of a confirm, use false otherwise
cUnicodeChar is the unicode character point for this keypress (and potentially multiple chars per press)
keyboard interactions, native keycode is the virtual key code value from your OS
Navigate to this URL, results in a HTML_StartRequest_t as the request commences
x and y are relative to the HTML bounds
Mouse click and mouse movement commands
nDelta is pixels of scroll
paste from the local clipboard to the current html page
Reload (most likely from local cache) the current page
Call this when you are done with a html surface, this lets us free the resources being used by it
Enable/disable low-resource background mode, where javascript and repaint timers are throttled, resources are
more aggressively purged from memory, and audio/video elements are paused. When background mode is enabled,
all HTML5 video and audio objects will execute ".pause()" and gain the property "._steam_background_paused = 1".
When background mode is disabled, any video or audio objects with that property will resume with ".play()".

memberdef.argsstring: (string pchHostname, string pchKey, string pchValue, string pchPath="/", uint nExpires=0, bool bSecure=false, bool bHTTPOnly=false)
memberdef.name: SetCookie

detaileddescription.para: set a webcookie for the hostname in question
Scale the output display space by this factor, this is useful when displaying content on high dpi devices.
Specifies the ratio between physical and logical pixels.
programmatically scroll this many pixels on the page
tell the html control if it has key focus currently, controls showing the I-beam cursor in text controls amongst other things

memberdef.argsstring: (HHTMLBrowser unBrowserHandle, float flZoom, int nPointX, int nPointY)
memberdef.name: SetPageScaleFactor

detaileddescription.para: Zoom the current page by flZoom ( from 0.0 to 2.0, so to zoom to 120% use 1.2 ), zooming around point X,Y in the page (use 0,0 if you don't care)
Tells the surface the size in pixels to display the surface
cancel a currently running find
Stop the load of the current html page
open the current pages html code in the local editor of choice, used for debugging
